intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a fox.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue the fox.
success_text: Your patrol finds the fox and drives it away.
s_c shows their strength, leading the fight against the fox until it gives up and runs.
The patrol overcomes the fox and sends it running, thanks to s_c's bravery.
fail_text: Your patrol fails to drive away the fox, but luckily there were no injuries.
s_c means well, but they're overconfident in their attack and the fox manages to sink their teeth into them. The patrol is forced to retreat, forming a defensive ring around the hurt s_c.
The brutish fox overwhelms the small patrol, and r_c falls to its vicious jaws.
r_c will carry their new scar with them from now on, but the fox leaves the clan's territory without further trouble.
history_text: r_c carries a scar from a fox fight.
r_c fell in battle with a fox.

intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a fox.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue the fox.
success_text: Your patrol finds the fox and drives it away.
The patrol mobs the fox, using their number to confuse it and attack it safely until it turns tail and runs.
s_c shows their strength, leading the fight against the fox until it gives up and runs.
The patrol overcomes the fox and sends it running, thanks to s_c's bravery.
fail_text: Your patrol fails to drive away the fox, but fortunately with so many cats to protect each other, no one was injured.
s_c means well, but they're overconfident in their attack and the fox manages to sink their teeth into them. The patrol is forced to retreat, forming a defensive ring around the hurt s_c.
r_c will carry their new scar with them from now on, but the fox leaves the clan's territory without further trouble.
history_text: r_c carries a scar from a fox fight.

intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a fox.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue the fox.
success_text: Your patrol finds the fox and drives it away.
s_c shows their strength, leading the fight against the fox until it gives up and runs.
With incredible bravery, s_c overcomes the fox and sends it running.
fail_text: s_c means well, but they're overconfident in their attack and the fox manages to sink their teeth into them. They escape into a tiny refuge, shivering with fear and blood loss.
The brutish fox overwhelms r_c, who dies a violent and lonesome death.
r_c will carry their new scar with them from now on, and the fox still lurks in c_n territory.
history_text: r_c carries a scar from a solo fox fight.
r_c fell in a solo battle with a fox.

intro_text: While helping gathering herbs, r_c stumbles upon a bush of red berries.
decline_text: r_c decides not to touch the berries.
success_text: Unsure but remembering the kittentales of red deathberries, r_c avoids them.
After careful consideration, r_c recognizes them as strawberries and brings the rare berries  back to the medicine cat's den.
Astutely, s_c recognises the cranberries, and carefully chews off a branch laden with them to bring back to camp - the herb stocks can use this odd fruit.
fail_text: Confidently gathering them and prancing back to camp, r_c is then informed that raspberries aren't a useful medicinal herb.

While plucking them from the bush, r_c feels one of the berries split in their mouth, and a horrible taste coats their tongue. They're rushed back to camp, where the medicine cat might have a chance at saving them from deathberry poisoning.

intro_text: While helping gathering herbs, r_c stumbles upon a bush of red berries.
decline_text: r_c decides not to touch the berries.
success_text: Unsure but remembering the kittentales of red deathberries, r_c avoids them.
Whatever. Identifying them is a medicine cat problem.  r_c plucks the berries and brings them back to camp, where it turns out they're called strawberries.
fail_text: Confidently gathering them and prancing back to camp, r_c is then informed that raspberries aren't a useful medicinal herb.

Whatever. Identifying them is a medicine cat problem.  r_c plucks the berries, several splitting in their mouth, and tries not to gag at the horrible taste - after all, all medicine cat herbs taste horrible. Right? They collapse on the way back to camp, and there's nothing any cat can do for them.

Whatever. Identifying them is a medicine cat problem.  r_c plucks the horrible tasting berries and brings them back to camp, where the medicine cat immediately starts work trying to save them from deathberry poisoning.

intro_text: The patrol finds a nice spot to sun themselves.
decline_text: They decide to stay focused instead.
success_text: The sunlight feels great and the cats have a successful patrol.
The sunlight energizes the cats for a training session.
s_c makes sure everyone gets a good basking spot as the cats pause for a little break before resuming their training.
fail_text: The patrol doesn't get much done because of that.

intro_text: r_c finds a nice spot to sun themselves.
decline_text: They decide to stay focused instead.
success_text: The sunlight feels great and r_c has a successful patrol.
The sunlight energizes r_c for a solo training session.
fail_text: The patrol doesn't get much done because of that.

intro_text: Your patrol has a disagreement and look to p_l to settle the dispute.
decline_text: Your patrol decides to head home.
success_text: p_l manages to skillfully smooth over any disagreement.
p_l listens to both sides, then makes a careful judgment. It keeps no one happy, the mark of an excellent compromise.
Talking everyone down, p_l encourages the patrol to focus on their work collecting nesting material.
p_l nods sympathetically, hearing out every side to the argument, and with their help the patrol feels comfortable, even with their differences.
fail_text: p_l stutters; they don't think they are fit to lead the patrol.
p_l rudely reminds the patrol cats to focus on their star-damned jobs and stop quarreling like kittens.

intro_text: Your patrol has a disagreement and look to p_l to settle the dispute.
decline_text: Your patrol decides to head home.
success_text: p_l manages to skillfully smooth over any disagreement.
p_l listens to both sides, then makes a careful judgment. It keeps no one happy, the mark of an excellent compromise.
Talking everyone down, p_l encourages the patrol to focus on their work.

p_l has no time for this scat, and pulls the patrol to a halt to remind them that they have a Star-damned job to do, and quarreling like kittens will not be tolerated. The patrol returns to their work collecting nesting material with newfound vigor.
fail_text: p_l stutters; they don't think they are fit to lead the patrol
p_l spends so much time listening sympathetically to every cat that the patrol gets nothing done, and as they return back home the quarrel continues.

intro_text: As the patrol gathers together to train, r_c admits they think they had a vision from StarClan last night.
decline_text: The patrol doesn't talk about the vision.
success_text: The patrol talks to them about whether it was a real vision as they train.
p_l takes r_c aside, giving them the full benefits of p_l's seniority and experience as they discuss r_c's vision.
s_c chooses to train with r_c, the spiritual warrior gently guiding the conversation. r_c feels deeply privileged and far more at peace after confiding in them.
fail_text: No one can make sense of the vision.
r_c notices p_l looking at them enviously, withdraws from the rest of the patrol, and dismisses the dream as unimportant.

intro_text: As they head out to work on their skills, r_c thinks about the dream they had last night . . . was it sent by Starclan?
decline_text: They push it from their mind.
success_text: It definitely distracts them from their training, but r_c uses the time by themselves to put their thoughts in order. It was a sign from their ancestors. Now they need to figure out what to do next.

Somehow training brings r_c to almost a meditative state, and not only are they fairly confident of their next steps having been given this vision, but they also take the opportunity to improve on a skill they think they're weak at.

s_c often feels like Starclan walks with them, and this is just another instance on the path. They use the solo patrol to collect their thoughts, and by the time they pad home with a hard day's training done, they're ready for the next step their vision hinted at.
fail_text: r_c can't make sense of the vision.

intro_text: The patrol quickly devolves into ghost stories, leaving everyone on edge.
decline_text: p_l quickly silences any talk about ghosts.
success_text: Despite the tense mood, the patrol is successful.
r_c spins a thrilling tale, and the patrol shivers with exciting, thrilled fear.

s_c sees the patrol competing to scare each other, and derails it completely. Instead they spin a tale of truth, bringing the story of one of c_n's warrior ancestors to life. With how clear their words are, it's almost like they know the Starclan cat, even though that's impossible.
fail_text: A branch snaps and the whole patrol runs back to camp.

intro_text: The patrol quickly devolves into ghost stories, leaving everyone on edge.
decline_text: p_l quickly silences any talk about ghosts.
success_text: p_l and r_c wind each other up, making up story after story in ever increasing tales of horror, until finally one sounds a little too ridiculous and both of them nearly fall over laughing, the tension erased as they giggle.
r_c wonders aloud if one of the ghost stories is true . . . the other cats gather close and comfort them. Time for the silly game to end, before someone actually gets upset.

s_c looks around, and with a deep breath, shakes off the tense vibe. Instead they start telling tall tales of long ago cats, completely disregarding anything approaching truth, so that the other cats on patrol start laughing and purring again.
fail_text: r_c tries to look brave in front of the other cats, but hears a rustle behind them and startles so badly they fall over.
p_l makes fun of r_c for being so scared.

intro_text: r_c is tempted to eat the prey they just caught. After all, they're only practicing hunting, right? So this is theirs, it doesn't count as a true hunting patrol?
decline_text: r_c decides against breaking the warrior code, resisting the temptation.
success_text: They eat the prey without anyone noticing.
Whatever, it's not a big deal, and r_c's hungry. They polish off the little snack, and keep working on their pounce.
fail_text: r_c eats the prey, but later they feel terrible about it, slinking around guilty and ashamed for the rest of the day.
r_c freezes in indecision, and eventually a warrior spots them sitting under cover with their prey and accuses r_c of eating it anyway.

intro_text: r_c is tempted to eat the prey they just caught. After all, they're only practicing hunting, right? So this is theirs, it doesn't count as a true hunting patrol?
decline_text: r_c decides against breaking the warrior code, resisting the temptation.
success_text: They eat the prey without anyone noticing.
r_c freezes in indecision. But the moment of peace allows them to collect their thoughts, and decide that the warrior code matters more to them than a silly afternoon snack.
fail_text: r_c eats the prey, but later they feel terrible about it, slinking around guilty and ashamed for the rest of the day.
Whatever, it's not a big deal, and r_c's hungry. But as they eat, a passing warrior spots them, and begins an outraged lecture on the values of the warrior code.

intro_text: r_c is tempted to eat the prey they just caught. After all, they're only practicing hunting, right? So this is theirs, it doesn't count as a true hunting patrol?
decline_text: r_c decides against breaking the warrior code, resisting the temptation.
success_text: They eat the prey without anyone noticing.
It definitely doesn't count as a proper hunting patrol. But just to be safe, r_c chooses to eat their afternoon snack under cover.
fail_text: r_c eats the prey, but later they feel terrible about it, slinking around guilty and ashamed for the rest of the day.

r_c ignores their rumbling belly, and dutifully brings the prey back to camp, only for their mentor to tell them to pick out a bite to eat before their stomach wakes every cat in camp. This would've all been much quicker if they'd eaten it when they first caught it.

intro_text: r_c is tempted to eat the prey they just caught. After all, they're only practicing hunting, right? So this is theirs, it doesn't count as a true hunting patrol?
decline_text: r_c decides against breaking the warrior code, resisting the temptation.
success_text: They eat the prey without anyone noticing.

r_c ignores their rumbling belly, and dutifully brings the prey back to camp. Their mentor congratulates them on the catch, and they get to share it with all their friends, feeling a warm glow in their heart at feeding their clan.
fail_text: r_c eats the prey, but later they feel terrible about it, slinking around guilty and ashamed for the rest of the day.
It definitely doesn't count as a proper hunting patrol. But irritatingly the warrior that comes past and spots r_c eating doesn't seem to agree, and a surly r_c is brought back to camp for a lecture.

intro_text: p_l suggests this might be a good chance for the cats to practice teamwork.
decline_text: They decide to focus on working on a different skill instead.
success_text: Everyone has a nice practice session and their coordination with their Clanmates grows stronger.

s_c takes charge and coordinates exercises for the training patrol. Soon cats are using each other as springboards, practicing breaking a clanmates' fall, and working on treading exactly in each other's pawsteps.
fail_text: Unfortunately, no one steps up to teach.

intro_text: p_l suggests this might be a good chance to practice teamwork with r_c.
decline_text: They decide to focus on working on a different skill instead.
success_text: Both cats have a nice practice session and their coordination with each other grows stronger.
s_c takes charge and coordinates exercises for the duo. They practice mirroring each other, until by the end of the afternoon they can almost act as one cat.
fail_text: Unfortunately, no one steps up to teach.

s_c takes charge and coordinates exercises for the duo. They practice mirroring each other, until by the end of the afternoon they can almost act as one cat. The warrior praises how quickly r_c picks it up, and the apprentice comes back to camp fluffed up with pride.

success_text: Everyone has a nice practice session, picking up a nice selection of new tricks to try out on their next hunting patrol.
s_c takes charge and coordinates exercises for the training patrol. Soon cats are practicing their stalking on each other, sharing tips about different terrain types, and discussing prey selection.
fail_text: Unfortunately, no one steps up to teach.

intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a fox.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue the fox.
success_text: The vixen smells of milk, and hopefully by driving her out of the territory, her litter this Newleaf won't be a threat to the clan.
Your patrol drives away the fox, seeks out her den, and kills her young cubs.
s_c displays incredible skill, driving the mother vixen out of the territory almost by themselves. Now neither the fox nor her cubs pose a threat to the clan.
The patrol overcomes the vixen and drives her off thanks to a brilliant battle move by s_c at a critical moment.
fail_text: The mother fox is vicious and determined, and the small patrol is beaten back.
s_c is determined to win, but their confidence is misplaced, and the vixen manages to sink her teeth into them. The patrol rallies around s_c, but they have to give up the fight.
Never threaten a mother's young - the vixen kills r_c in the skirmish.
The mother fox's snapping jaws leave a permanent mark on r_c, and force the patrol to back off.
history_text: r_c carries a scar from a fox fight.
r_c fell in battle with a fox.

intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a fox.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue the fox.
success_text: Led by p_l, and with a heap of cooperation and teamwork, the patrol drives away the fox, seeks out her den, and kills her young cubs.
With so many cats working together in tight coordination, they manage to accomplish the near-impossible, killing the mother vixen and ending the threat to the clan that she and her cubs pose.
s_c displays incredible skill, driving the mother vixen out of the territory almost by themselves. Now neither the fox nor her cubs pose a threat to the clan.
The patrol overcomes the vixen and drives her off thanks to a brilliant battle move by s_c at a critical moment.
fail_text: The mother fox is vicious and determined, but although they lose this battle, through teamwork the cats manage to retreat without injury.
s_c is determined to win, but their confidence is misplaced, and the vixen manages to sink her teeth into them. The patrol rallies around s_c, but they have to give up the fight.
r_c is left with a small scar, as the patrol and the mother vixen fight to a stalemate.
history_text: r_c carries a scar from a fox fight.

intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a fox.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue the fox.

A brilliant battle move by s_c at a critical moment knocks the vixen off balance, and s_c manages to drive her out of c_n territory, though it takes every spark of strength in their pelt to do it.
fail_text: s_c is determined to win, but the vixen is determined to live, and that makes all the difference. s_c ends up pinned in a defensible hiding spot, bleeding and terrified, until the vixen judges them no longer a threat and continues on her way.

s_c displays incredible skill, driving the mother vixen out of the territory all by themselves. Now neither the fox nor her cubs pose a threat to the clan.
A brilliant battle move by s_c at a critical moment knocks the vixen off balance, and s_c manages to drive her out of c_n territory, though it takes every spark of strength in their pelt to do it.
fail_text: s_c is determined to win, but the vixen is determined to live, and that makes all the difference. s_c ends up pinned in a defensible hiding spot, bleeding and terrified, until the vixen judges them no longer a threat and continues on her way.
Never threaten a mother's young - the vixen kills r_c in the skirmish, and carries off the body to feed her litter.
The mother fox's snapping jaws leave a permanent mark on r_c, and force the patrol to back off.
history_text: r_c carries a scar from a solo fight with a vixen.
r_c fell in a solo battle with a vixen.

intro_text: The patrol wants to hold a training session for r_c.  They decide to focus on tree climbing!
decline_text: They decide to focus on the patrolling the territory instead, training can wait for another day.
success_text: r_c listens carefully as the proper techniques of tree climbing are explained.
r_c picks up the instruction quickly and follows the directions of the other patrol members as they climb up the tree.
By the end of the patrol s_c is leaping from branch to branch, as nimble as a squirrel.
fail_text: r_c manages to get into the tree, but climbing back down proves to be a problem.
s_c struggles to take the lesson seriously and eventually the training session ends early with no real progress made.
r_c begins making their way up into the tree, but a branch cracks and breaks beneath their weight!  The apprentice is sent crashing back to the ground, hurting their paw in the process.
history_text: r_c got scarred training in the forest as an apprentice.

intro_text: r_c wanders past an old badger sett in the roots of a hazelnut tree, only to freeze. There's new scent here, acrid and sour.
decline_text: Surely it must be nothing . . . uneasily, r_c continues on.
success_text: Feeling ever so alone on their solo patrol, r_c carefully sniffs around the mouth of the burrow, but the scent change is unmistakable - a new badger occupant has moved in. Creeping forward, belly flat in the dirt, they manage just enough of a glimpse to confirm the badger's presence before it moves and r_c shoots backwards, sprinting back to camp to warn everyone.

Feeling ever so alone on their solo patrol, r_c carefully sniffs around the mouth of the burrow, but after a few moments, realizes that the scent is relatively weak.  A badger was here, no doubt about it, but it doesn't seem to have taken up residence.  This will be important information to report back at camp.

s_c decides there has to be a smarter way of figuring out if a badger has moved in, one that doesn't involve sticking their head in front of a predator. They search the clearing around the sett thoroughly, and come up with fresh badger scat, stinky, horrible, and perfect proof of the new occupant of the sett.

Carefully considering their options, r_c decides to set up a stakeout. When the badger pokes its head above ground at dusk, they're prepared, and dart off back to camp to warn everyone before the predator has blinked the sleep out of its eyes.
fail_text: Well, the only way to know is to check! s_c scrambles into the den for a look, and it's only by the grace of Starclan that they're able to redirect that speed to twist around just as fast, furious fizzing following them up the burrow tunnel, leaving behind clumps of their own fur.

r_c carefully approaches the burrow, trying to figure out if there's anything new inside. It's so dark, and it all smells the same, so they try to creep just a little closer - but the floor drops away steeply below their paws, and they lose their grip, skidding downwards into a disturbed and lethal badger.

While r_c is carefully sniffing at the burrow entrance, there's a rustle from the woods behind them. It's difficult to say who's more surprised, r_c or the badger, and it charges towards the sett. r_c leaps out of the way, but its claws catch their pelt, and it's a bloodied cat that limps back into camp to report the whole sorry adventure.
history_text: r_c was scarred by a badger.
r_c lost their life to a badger.

intro_text: p_l wanders past an old badger sett in the roots of a hazelnut tree, only to freeze. There's new scent here, acrid and sour.
decline_text: Surely it must be nothing… uneasily, the patrol continues on.
success_text: Calling the rest of the patrol over, the cats discuss their next move. If a badger has moved in, they need to confirm it, but how? Eventually p_l comes up with a plan, stuffing bushes into the mouth of the sett. The cats will be able to come back tomorrow, and see if anything has shoved them out of the way.

This can't be left unknown. p_l organizes the patrol, and together they lift a huge long skinny branch off from the forest floor, shoving the end into the sett. With half the branch's length to go there's an outraged explosion of fizzing from the depths of the burrow, and the patrol retreat to report back to camp. Any luck, and they'll have managed to stab the beast slightly, but no one is going to stay and check.

s_c decides there has to be a smarter way of figuring out if a badger has moved in, one that doesn't involve sticking their head in front of a predator. They lead the patrol on a search of the clearing around the sett, and come up with fresh badger scat, stinky, horrible, and perfect proof of the new occupant.

Carefully considering their options, s_c decides to set up a stakeout with the patrol. When the badger pokes its head above the ground at dusk, they're prepared, and everyone turns for home before the predator has blinked the sleep out of its eyes.
fail_text: The cats try to find enough bits of undergrowth in the nearby forest to block the opening to the sett, but the area is bare, and before they know it they're tired, thirsty, and with nothing to show for it.

Well, the only way to know is to check! s_c scrambles into the den for a look, and it's only by the grace of Starclan that they're able to redirect that speed to twist around just as fast, furious fizzing following them up the burrow tunnel, leaving behind clumps of their own fur.

While the patrol are sniffing at the burrow entrance there's a rustle from the woods. It's difficult to say who's more surprised, cats or badger, and it charges towards the sett. There's a confused rush with paws and fur flying as the melee of creatures tries to sort itself out, and it ends with one badger returned to home and a couple of battered patrol members. In a couple moons, this'll probably be a funny story.
history_text: This cat was scarred by a badger.

intro_text: Up at the front of the patrol, p_l hears a loud crash and startled yowling. Turning back, they bound over to find r_c pinned under branches that have just fallen from the canopy.
decline_text: p_l runs back to camp to fetch help.
success_text: p_l frees their clanmate, and settles down to groom the twigs from their pelt, everyone relieved to have gotten off so lightly.
p_l tugs on just the right branch, lifting the pile from r_c for long enough for the other cat to scramble free.

Not letting themselves panic, s_c carefully assesses the branches trapping their clanmate, then throws their weight on one. It acts as a lever, forcing the entire pile up and letting r_c scrabble out gratefully.
Creeping in as close as possible, s_c purrs to their clanmate, keeping them calm as the patrol carefully removes the branches pinning them down.
fail_text: The patrol works all day to free their clanmate and gets nothing else done.
Harshly, s_c tells their clanmate that they're on their own - this patrol is too important to wait for some idiot who got stuck.
p_l works frantically, but r_c is too badly pinned under the branches, and slips away as the patrol tries desperately to free them.
The patrol eventually manages to rescue r_c, but they need to be helped back to camp, battered and injured.
history_text: r_c carries a scar from being trapped on patrol
r_c tragically died after being trapped on patrol.

intro_text: Trailing behind the patrol, there's a mighty crash above r_c. The look around wildly, just in time for the world to be blotted over by a tangle of heavy falling branches.
decline_text: Thankfully, they're on the edge of the obstruction, and wriggle their way clear.
success_text: Their clanmates come running at their yowls, and r_c is soon freed, shaken but unharmed. The patrol settles down with them, as everyone comforts each other.
p_l tugs on just the right branch, lifting the pile from r_c for long enough for the other cat to scramble free.

Not letting themselves panic, s_c carefully assesses the branches trapping their clanmate, then throws their weight on one. It acts as a lever, forcing the entire pile up and letting r_c scrabble out gratefully.

Creeping in as close as possible, s_c purrs to r_c, keeping them calm as the patrol carefully removes the branches pinning them down. r_c blinks up at them, holding on to their presence in the scary situation.
fail_text: The patrol works all day to free r_c and gets nothing else done.
Harshly, s_c tells r_c that they're on their own - this patrol is too important to wait for some idiot who got stuck.
Hurt and wheezing, r_c hears the patrol panicking as they drift to Starclan.
The patrol eventually manages to rescue r_c, but they need to be helped back to camp, battered and injured.
history_text: r_c carries a scar from being trapped on patrol
r_c tragically died after being trapped on patrol.

intro_text: r_c heads out into the forest alone, but maybe an apprentice shouldn't try to do a solo patrol.
decline_text: r_c turns back to camp, deciding that this is a bad idea.
success_text: At least this is a good chance to learn the territory! r_c heads off to map out a thicket they've always found confusing.
r_c rounds a corner and stumbles across a tiny, perfect waterfall!
There's nothing to worry about! s_c pads confidently through c_n territory, assured in their safety by the strength of c_n borders.
fail_text: r_c gets lost in the territory and doesn't learn anything.
s_c shivers a little, imagining what could be out there. . . no, definitely not. They turn around and go straight back to camp.
The apprentice wanders along obliviously, and tumbles right down a well hidden gully. Bruised and sore, r_c has to report to the medicine cat den when they return to camp.
history_text: r_c got injured as an apprentice, exploring alone.

intro_text: r_c heads out into the forest alone, wanting to explore and have some time to themselves.
decline_text: r_c turns back to camp, deciding that their duties have to come first.
success_text: r_c heads off to map out a thicket they've always found confusing. Hunting, fighting, driving off predators, it all requires knowledge of their home turf, it's always worth making sure their mental map is up to date.
r_c rounds a corner and stumbles across a tiny, perfect waterfall!

s_c rounds a corner and stumbles across a tiny, perfect waterfall! Further investigation shows it emerging from an equally tiny spring, and s_c purrs. This reliable water source could be important during times of drought.

s_c pads confidently through c_n territory. There's a particular peace in exploring their beloved home, ears pricked up curiously whenever they spot how the seasons and weather have reshaped it since they last passed this way.
fail_text: r_c gets lost in the territory. Somehow.
s_c shivers a little, thinking of the dangers of solo patrols. . . no, definitely not. They turn around and go straight back to camp.

intro_text: r_c heads out into the forest alone, wanting to explore and have some time to themselves.
decline_text: r_c turns back to camp, deciding that their duties have to come first.
success_text: r_c heads off to map out a thicket they've always found confusing. Hunting, fighting, driving off predators, it all requires knowledge of their home turf, it's always worth making sure their mental map is up to date. It feels a little like more work though, and isn't exactly the peaceful break they hoped for.
r_c rounds a corner and stumbles across a tiny, perfect waterfall! Purring, they take the opportunity for a small moment of peace, relaxing and enjoying the view.

s_c rounds a corner and stumbles across a tiny, perfect waterfall! Further investigation shows it emerging from an equally tiny spring, and s_c purrs. This reliable water source could be important during times of drought, there's a relief to discovering it.

s_c pads confidently through c_n territory. There's a particular peace in exploring their beloved home, ears pricked up curiously whenever they spot how the seasons and weather have reshaped it since they last passed this way.
fail_text: r_c gets lost in the territory. Somehow.
s_c wavers in their decision. They have so much work to do, so many other things pulling on their time. . . no, definitely not. They turn around and go straight back to camp.

decline_text: r_c turns back to camp, deciding that their duties have to come first.

intro_text: The patrol wants to hold a training session for r_c.  They decide to focus on how best to hide within the tall grass.
decline_text: They decide to focus on the patrolling the territory instead, training can wait for another day.
success_text: r_c listens carefully as the p_l explains how to move through the grass unseen and undetected.
r_c picks up the instruction quickly and the patrol soon plays a small game of hide and seek within the grass to test the apprentice's abilities.
By the end of the patrol s_c is able to hide stealthily within the grass, their movements barely noticeable.
fail_text: r_c tries to hide within the grass, but they can't quite manage to make themselves still and quiet enough to avoid detection.
s_c struggles to take the lesson seriously and eventually the training session ends early with no real progress made.

r_c makes their way into the tall grass to try out the advice p_l has given them, but they go crashing down into a hole, where whatever lives there gives them a sharp bite!  It seems the grass was hiding more than just cats.  r_c ends up limping back to camp.
history_text: r_c got scarred training in the plains as an apprentice.

history_text: r_c was scarred by a badger.
r_c lost their life to a badger.

intro_text: p_l wanders past an old badger sett dug into the rocky hillside, only to freeze. There's new scent here, acrid and sour.
decline_text: Surely it must be nothing… uneasily, the patrol continues on.
success_text: Calling the rest of the patrol over, the cats discuss their next move. If a badger has moved in, they need to confirm it. Eventually p_l comes up with a plan, stuffing loose rocks around the mouth of the sett. The cats will be able to come back tomorrow, and see if anything has shoved them out of the way.

This can't be left unknown. The patrol brainstorms ideas, and the solution they hit upon is almost a game, batting pebbles down the burrow with as much force as each cat can muster. p_l wins the grand prize, thwacking a pebble down into the sett that causes an explosion of outraged fizzing, as the badger inside is rudely awakened.

s_c decides there has to be a smarter way of figuring out if a badger has moved in, one that doesn't involve sticking their head in front of a predator. They lead the patrol on a search of the slope around the sett, and come up with fresh badger scat, stinky, horrible, and perfect proof of the new occupant.

Carefully considering their options, s_c decides to set up a stakeout with the patrol. When the badger pokes its head above the ground at dusk, they're prepared, and everyone turns for home, fading through the grass before the predator has blinked the sleep out of its eyes.
fail_text: The cats try to find enough rubble to barricade around the opening to the sett, but the area is pretty bare. Before they know it they're tired, thirsty, and returning home with nothing to show for it.

Well, the only way to know is to check! s_c scrambles into the den for a look, and it's only by the grace of Starclan that they're able to redirect that speed to twist around just as fast, furious fizzing following them up the burrow tunnel, leaving behind clumps of their own fur.

While the patrol are sniffing at the burrow entrance there's a clatter of rocks behind them. It's difficult to say who's more surprised, cats or badger, and it charges towards the sett. There's a confused rush with paws flying as the melee of creatures tries to sort itself out, and it ends with one badger returned to home and a couple of battered patrol members. In a couple moons, this'll probably be a funny story.
history_text: This cat was scarred by a badger.

intro_text: Up at the front of the patrol, p_l hears a loud crash and startled yowling. Turning back, they spot r_c being swallowed as a scree slope collapses.
decline_text: p_l runs back to camp to fetch help.
success_text: p_l frees their clanmate, and settles down to groom the dust from their pelt, everyone relieved to have gotten off so lightly.
p_l digs through the loose rocks, lifting them from r_c for long enough for the other cat to scramble free.
Not letting themselves panic, s_c carefully assesses the collapsed slope trapping their clanmate. They point out a stable path to dig them out from above, and r_c is recovered, scared but okay.
Creeping in as close as possible, s_c purrs to their clanmate, keeping them calm as the patrol carefully digs down to them.
fail_text: The patrol works all day to free their clanmate and gets nothing else done.
Harshly, s_c tells their clanmate that they're on their own - this patrol is too important to wait for some idiot who got stuck.
p_l works frantically, but r_c is too badly crushed by the rocky collapse, and slips away as the patrol tries desperately to free them.
The patrol eventually manages to rescue r_c, but they need to be helped back to camp, battered and injured.
history_text: r_c carries a scar from being trapped on patrol
r_c tragically died after being trapped on patrol.

intro_text: Trailing behind the patrol, there's a mighty crash below r_c. They look around wildly, just in time for the world to tip upside-down as the scree slope beneath them collapses.
decline_text: Thankfully, they're on the edge of the obstruction, and wriggle their way clear.
success_text: Their clanmates come running at their yowls, and r_c is soon freed, shaken but unharmed. The patrol settles down as everyone comforts each other.
p_l digs through the loose rocks, lifting them from r_c for long enough for the other cat to scramble free.
Not letting themselves panic, s_c carefully assesses the collapsed slope trapping their clanmate. They point out a stable path to dig them out from above, and r_c is recovered, scared but okay.
Creeping in as close as possible, s_c purrs to r_c, keeping them calm as the patrol carefully digs down to them. r_c blinks up at them, holding on to their presence in the scary situation.
fail_text: The patrol works all day to free r_c and gets nothing else done.
Harshly, s_c tells r_c that they're on their own - this patrol is too important to wait for some idiot who got stuck.
Hurt and wheezing, r_c hears the patrol panicking as they drift to Starclan.
The patrol eventually manages to rescue r_c, but they need to be helped back to camp, battered and injured.
history_text: r_c carries a scar from being trapped on patrol
r_c tragically died after being trapped on patrol.

intro_text: r_c heads out into the mountains alone, but maybe an apprentice shouldn't try to do a solo patrol.
decline_text: r_c turns back to camp, deciding that this is a bad idea.
success_text: At least this is a good chance to learn the territory! r_c heads off to map out a field of boulders they've always found confusing.
r_c clambers over a rise in the ground and stumbles across a tiny, perfect, sheltered gully, thick with bushes and prey scent.
There's nothing to worry about! s_c pads confidently through c_n territory, assured in their safety by the strength of c_n borders.
fail_text: r_c gets lost in the territory and doesn't learn anything.
s_c shivers a little, imagining what could be out there. . . no, definitely not. They turn around and go straight back to camp.
The apprentice wanders along obliviously, and tumbles right down a gap in the path. Bruised and sore, r_c has to report to the medicine cat den when they return to camp.
history_text: r_c got injured as an apprentice, exploring alone.

intro_text: r_c heads out into the mountains alone, wanting to explore and have some time to themselves.
decline_text: r_c turns back to camp, deciding that their duties have to come first.
success_text: r_c heads off to map out a field of boulders they've always found confusing. Hunting, fighting, driving off predators, it all requires knowledge of their home turf, it's always worth making sure their mental map is up to date.
r_c rounds a corner and stumbles across a tiny, perfect, sheltered gully, thick with bushes and prey scent.

s_c rounds a corner and stumbles across a  tiny, perfect, sheltered gully, thick with bushes and prey scent. Further investigation shows it will be sheltered from almost all wind directions, and s_c purrs. This reliable prey source will be important during Leaf-bare.

s_c pads confidently through c_n territory. There's a particular peace in exploring their beloved home, ears pricked up curiously whenever they spot how the seasons and weather have reshaped it since they last passed this way.
fail_text: r_c gets lost in the territory. Somehow.
s_c shivers a little, thinking of the dangers of solo patrols. . . no, definitely not. They turn around and go straight back to camp.

intro_text: r_c heads out into the mountains alone, wanting to explore and have some time to themselves.
decline_text: r_c turns back to camp, deciding that their duties have to come first.
success_text: r_c heads off to map out a field of boulders they've always found confusing. Hunting, fighting, driving off predators, it all requires knowledge of their home turf, it's always worth making sure their mental map is up to date. It feels a little like more work though, and isn't exactly the peaceful break they hoped for.

r_c rounds a corner and stumbles across a tiny, perfect, sheltered gully, thick with bushes and prey scent. Purring, they take the opportunity for a small moment of peace, relaxing and enjoying the view.

s_c rounds a corner and stumbles across a  tiny, perfect, sheltered gully, thick with bushes and prey scent. Further investigation shows it will be sheltered from almost all wind directions, and s_c purrs. This reliable prey source will be important during Leaf-bare, there's a relief to discovering it.

s_c pads confidently through c_n territory. There's a particular peace in exploring their beloved home, ears pricked up curiously whenever they spot how the seasons and weather have reshaped it since they last passed this way.
fail_text: r_c gets lost in the territory. Somehow.
s_c wavers in their decision. They have so much work to do, so many other things pulling on their time. . . no, definitely not. They turn around and go straight back to camp.
